12 Jul

Customers are people, not numbers. They want to be engaged and have trust in your brand before they’ll make a purchasing decision.

We also need to recognize that while there is a significant amount of value in utilizing social media as a marketing channel, we need to be realistic about what we will gain by interacting socially. We may not see immediate gratification (a conversion or purchase) but we’re spending time interacting where are customers are spending their time, and working to build trust in the process.

Good insights from the ClickZ crew on a Gallup survey showing that the direct impact of social media on purchases is not as high as previously reported.

(from: 3 Social Media Marketing Takeaways From Gallup’s Study | ClickZ)

By $cale¢hange interactive, Social Media, Social Media Marketing 0 Comments Read more...

Scalechange's weekly newsletter features curated submissions from active and experienced agents of change. Each issue of The Changemaker voyages into one particular subsection of the uncharted inner space between the business and nonprofit sectors, also known as the fourth sector - civilization's final frontier!
